tweet.tweet_content: The Moon has given us months, tides and a destination that ever-beckons. It's time we build a rocket and go to stay.
A little Saturday silliness. Jurassic math class.
44 years ago today Mike, Buzz & Neil took us to the Moon. They inspired me like no other. Eternal thanks.
These 3 women are so fun and good to know & play with. Just listen how they sang O Canada - under pressure!
A hot July day, a bright window on Boston, a good day for new ideas.
Death Valley looking every inch of its name.
Sharing a different perspective. My flying boots and I gave a talk at the Cdn Embassy in Washington DC.
When she really wants to, Nature can draw straight lines in the chaos.
Happy Birthday, John Glenn! One of the truly great Americans, turns 92 today . A life's example and hero to me.
The relationship started rocky, but I learned to tame the beast. We departed as good friends.
Alex Colville - to have believed in your imagination and expressed it to the fullest is to have lived. RIP.
I stayed up late one night in April to catch the morning light on the artwork that is the Outback.
Good morning from Washington DC! The sounds of the city are revving through my hotel window. Politics getting to work.
Cool handmade guitar, donated & signed, being auctioned for Alberta flood relief. Built-in pickup, they play great!
It is never too soon to moustache, apparently. Having fun near Boston at .
Lots of water is inexplicably collecting in Luca's helmet. Where is it coming from? To be safe, NASA is stopping the spacewalk. Good idea.
Spacewalk! Chris & Luca are going outside the Space Station today with a long list of jobs. Hard risky work.
It may seem like looking into a microscope, but this is actually the Iranian countryside, as-seen from orbit.
Hello Boston! Great to be working w/the FableVision team at the Children's Museum. Inspiring place! !
Good Morning! I found the last 45 sec of this short lightning video fascinating - beautiful to see & educational:

Death Valley looking every inch of its name.

When she really wants to, Nature can draw straight lines in the chaos.

Good morning from Washington DC! The sounds of the city are revving through my hotel window. Politics getting to work.

It is never too soon to moustache, apparently. Having fun near Boston at .

Spacewalk! Chris & Luca are going outside the Space Station today with a long list of jobs. Hard risky work.

Hello Boston! Great to be working w/the FableVision team at the Children's Museum. Inspiring place! !
